title: Kill switch for hibernate-orm + datasource for @QuarkusTest
body:
### Description

Using 2.16.4.Final I have a common module with Panache enties, incl. finders etc.

Now I wanted to write a unit test which need quarkus magic which comes with `@QuarkusTest` but does not need hibernate-orm datasource, flyway, devservices.
So I set properties (basically bombing with properties trying to disable hibernate-orm + datasource) 
```
Map.of(
        "quarkus.datasource.mydatasource.devservices.enabled","false",
        "quarkus.datasource.mydatasource.jdbc.url", "jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/mydatasource",

        "quarkus.hibernate-orm.validate-in-dev-mode", "false",
        "quarkus.hibernate-orm.mydatasource.packages", "none",
        "quarkus.hibernate-orm.mydatasource.enabled","false",
        "quarkus.hibernate-orm.mydatasource.active","false"

        "quarkus.devservices.enabled", "false",

        "quarkus.flyway.mydatasource.clean-at-start","false",
        "quarkus.flyway.mydatasource.migrate-at-start","false",
    );
```

..which got devservices and flyway obviously disabled. 

But HibernateOrmProcessor still tries to spin up persistence unit. Where is the kill switch?

### Implementation ideas

Would be nice to have a property (or I maybe just missed it) to disable all hibernate-orm, datasource stuff.

It would be even better to have very high level propery that disables everything related to hibernate-orm, datasource, flyway, devservices (for db), especially interesting to accellerate unit tests while keeping using `@QuarkusTest`
